zone.line: Preface
The {g}reek tragic writers in selecting as thier
subject any portion of their national
history or mythology, employed in
thier treatment of it a certain arbi
-trary discretion. They by no means
conceived themselves bound to adhere
to the common interpretation, or to
imitate in story as in th{e} title their
rivals & predecessors. Such a system
w have amounted to a resignation of
those claims to preference over their
competitors which incited the com-
Violet
-position. The Agamenmonian story
was exhibited on the Athenian theatre
with as many variations as dramas.
I have presumed to employ a similar
license-- The "Prometheus unbound" of
Ã†schylus, supposed the reconciliation of
Jupiter with his victim as the
price of the disclosure of the
danger threatened to his empire
